body_html: Yes, this is expected, as view is only supposed to work on contiguous tensors, and transposing a tensor makes it non-contiguous. You can use .contiguous() after transpose to fix your issue
body_text: Yes, this is expected, as view is only supposed to work on contiguous tensors, and transposing a tensor makes it non-contiguous. You can use .contiguous() after transpose to fix your issue
body: Yes, this is expected, as `view` is only supposed to work on contiguous tensors, and transposing a tensor makes it non-contiguous. You can use `.contiguous()` after `transpose` to fix your issue
